1.caption_en:
Digital Disruption is transforming industries from producer-centric to consumer-centric platform ecosystems, shown by a "World before Platforms" vs "World with Platforms" comparison and three pressures on incumbents: loss of consumer contact, shrinking margins, and the need to build connected services.

{
  "artifactType": "slide/infographic",
  "language": "English",
  "titleText": "Digital Disruption is happing now in all sectors dominated by the new rules of the platform economy",
  "mainSections": [
    {
      "sectionTitle": "World before Platforms",
      "description": "Concentric circular diagram placing 'Consumer' at the center with traditional companies and producers arranged in outer rings and labeled sector segments (Living, Mobility, Health/Recreat., Work, Consumption, Education, Socialize, Entertainment).",
      "visibleLogosExamples": [
        "Sony",
        "SAP",
        "Microsoft",
        "DB",
        "ZARA",
        "DHL",
        "TUI",
        "e.on"
      ]
    },
    {
      "sectionTitle": "World with Platforms",
      "description": "Concentric circular diagram showing 'Consumer' at center surrounded by a new ring of platform companies and ecosystem providers; platform logos replace or sit between traditional producers.",
      "visibleLogosExamples": [
        "Uber",
        "Airbnb",
        "YouTube",
        "Facebook",
        "LinkedIn",
        "Udemy",
        "Amazon",
        "SAP",
        "Stanford"
      ]
    }
  ],
  "rightColumn": {
    "heading": "Increased Pressure for incumbent companies",
    "bullets": [
      "Losing contact with consumers & market insights",
      "Shrinking margins for product & asset heavy companies",
      "Pressure to build connected services for integrated consumer experiences"
    ]
  },
  "footerText": "Roles in the Value Chain: Enablers Producers",
  "attribution": "Adapted from: Kawohl, Krechting, 2018, www.ecosystemizer.com",
  "visualNotes": "Overall slide uses teal and coral accent colors; two circular diagrams occupy left and center, explanatory coral boxes on right; consumer icon centered in both diagrams."
}

2.caption_en:
Digital infographic comparing a "World before Platforms" with a "World with Platforms," showing the consumer at the center while platform companies (e.g., Uber, Airbnb, Facebook) encircle and displace traditional producers and enablers, and listing pressures on incumbents like loss of consumer contact, shrinking margins, and the need to build connected services.

{
  "type": "infographic",
  "title": "Digital Disruption is happing now in all sectors dominated by the new rules of the platform economy",
  "description": "Side-by-side comparison of 'World before Platforms' and 'World with Platforms' depicting consumers at the center of concentric value-chain rings and a side panel listing increased pressures on incumbent companies.",
  "left_section": {
    "label": "World before Platforms",
    "center": "Consumer",
    "rings": [
      {
        "ring": "inner",
        "role": "producers",
        "examples": [
          "Sony",
          "SAP",
          "Microsoft",
          "ZARA",
          "DHL",
          "TUI",
          "DB",
          "E.ON",
          "Intel",
          "Nokia",
          "T-Mobile",
          "Stanford University",
          "Bertelsmannstiftung"
        ]
      },
      {
        "ring": "outer",
        "role": "enablers",
        "examples": [
          "Sector labels: Living",
          "Mobility",
          "Health/Recreation",
          "Work",
          "Consumption",
          "Education",
          "Socialize",
          "Entertainment"
        ]
      }
    ]
  },
  "right_section": {
    "label": "World with Platforms",
    "center": "Consumer",
    "rings": [
      {
        "ring": "inner",
        "role": "platforms",
        "examples": [
          "Uber",
          "Airbnb",
          "YouTube",
          "Facebook",
          "LinkedIn",
          "Udemy",
          "Amazon"
        ]
      },
      {
        "ring": "middle",
        "role": "producers",
        "examples": [
          "ZARA",
          "DHL",
          "SAP",
          "Microsoft",
          "TUI",
          "DB",
          "Sony"
        ]
      },
      {
        "ring": "outer",
        "role": "enablers",
        "examples": [
          "Sector labels: Living",
          "Mobility",
          "Health/Recreation",
          "Work",
          "Consumption",
          "Education",
          "Socialize",
          "Entertainment"
        ]
      }
    ]
  },
  "side_panel": {
    "header": "Increased Pressure for incumbent companies",
    "bullets": [
      "Losing contact with consumers & market insights",
      "Shrinking margins for product & asset heavy companies",
      "Pressure to build connected services for integrated consumer experiences"
    ]
  },
  "legend": "Roles in the Value Chain: Enablers, Producers, Platforms",
  "source": "Adapted from: Kawohl, Krechting, 2018, www.ecosystemizer.com"
}

3.caption_en:
A concentric "consumer" ecosystem wheel showing a central consumer icon surrounded by platform services (inner yellow ring), partner brands (middle white ring), and life-domain sectors (outer teal ring) labeled Living, Mobility, Health/Recreation, Work, Consumption, Education, Socialize, and Entertainment.

{
  "caption": "A concentric consumer ecosystem wheel showing a central consumer icon surrounded by platform services (inner yellow ring), partner brands (middle white ring), and life-domain sectors (outer teal ring) labeled Living, Mobility, Health/Recreation, Work, Consumption, Education, Socialize, and Entertainment.",
  "type": "diagram",
  "layout": "concentric circular diagram with four concentric layers: central core, inner service ring, middle brand ring, and outer sector ring divided into labeled sectors",
  "central_core": {
    "label": "Consumer",
    "icon": "generic user silhouette",
    "color": "teal/blue"
  },
  "inner_ring": {
    "color": "yellow",
    "description": "platform / service logos closest to consumer",
    "logos": [
      "Airbnb",
      "Uber",
      "YouTube",
      "Facebook",
      "LinkedIn",
      "Udemy",
      "Amazon (shopping cart icon)",
      "fitness/running app icon"
    ]
  },
  "middle_ring": {
    "color": "white/light grey",
    "description": "additional company/brand logos organized by sector",
    "logos": [
      "E.ON",
      "Vonovia",
      "Knorr-Bremse",
      "Deutsche Bahn (DB)",
      "TUI",
      "Fresenius Medical Care",
      "SAP",
      "Microsoft",
      "ZARA",
      "DHL",
      "Stanford University",
      "Bertelsmann Stiftung",
      "Nokia",
      "T-Mobile",
      "Intel",
      "Sony"
    ]
  },
  "outer_ring": {
    "color": "teal",
    "sectors_clockwise_from_top": [
      "Living",
      "Mobility",
      "Health / Recreat.",
      "Work",
      "Consumption",
      "Education",
      "Socialize",
      "Entertainment"
    ]
  },
  "colors_used": {
    "outer_ring": "teal",
    "inner_service_ring": "yellow",
    "core": "teal/blue",
    "middle_ring": "white/light grey",
    "text": "white and dark navy"
  },
  "text_elements_present": [
    "Consumer",
    "Living",
    "Mobility",
    "Health / Recreat.",
    "Work",
    "Consumption",
    "Education",
    "Socialize",
    "Entertainment"
  ],
  "approximate_logo_count": 24,
  "observations": "Diagram maps brands and platforms to life domains with proximity indicating relationship to the consumer; inner ring contains major consumer platforms, middle ring contains sector-specific brands, outer ring labels life domains.",
  "notes": "Logo identifications are based on visible marks in the image; some small logos are interpreted by shape and color and may represent similar brand variants."
}

4.caption_en:
A concentric circular infographic that places the consumer at the center and maps brands and institutions across rings into eight outer sectors (Living, Mobility, Health/Recreation, Work, Consumption, Education, Socialize, Entertainment) to illustrate a consumer ecosystem. The diagram shows major consumer-facing companies on an inner yellow ring, sector-specific organizations on a middle ring, and labeled sectors on an outer teal ring.

{
  "type": "circular_consumer_ecosystem_infographic",
  "title": "Consumer-centered brand and sector map",
  "center": {
    "label": "Consumer",
    "icon": "person_silhouette",
    "color": "teal"
  },
  "rings": [
    {
      "name": "inner",
      "order": 1,
      "color": "yellow",
      "description": "Core consumer-facing digital and retail brands",
      "elements": [
        { "name": "airbnb", "category": "Living/Services" },
        { "name": "UBER", "category": "Mobility" },
        { "name": "YouTube", "category": "Entertainment" },
        { "name": "Facebook", "category": "Socialize" },
        { "name": "LinkedIn", "category": "Work/Socialize" },
        { "name": "udemy", "category": "Education" },
        { "name": "amazon", "category": "Consumption" },
        { "name": "ZARA", "category": "Consumption" },
        { "name": "DHL", "category": "Consumption/Logistics" },
        { "name": "fitness_app_icon", "category": "Health/Recreation" }
      ]
    },
    {
      "name": "middle",
      "order": 2,
      "color": "white",
      "description": "Sector-specific companies and institutions",
      "elements": [
        { "name": "e.on", "sector": "Living" },
        { "name": "vonovia", "sector": "Living" },
        { "name": "Knorr-Bremse", "sector": "Mobility" },
        { "name": "DB (Deutsche Bahn)", "sector": "Mobility" },
        { "name": "TUI", "sector": "Health / Recreation" },
        { "name": "Fresenius Medical Care", "sector": "Health / Recreation" },
        { "name": "SAP", "sector": "Work" },
        { "name": "Microsoft", "sector": "Work" },
        { "name": "Stanford University", "sector": "Education" },
        { "name": "BertelsmannStiftung", "sector": "Education" },
        { "name": "Nokia", "sector": "Socialize/Communication" },
        { "name": "T-Mobile", "sector": "Socialize/Communication" },
        { "name": "Sony", "sector": "Entertainment/Tech" },
        { "name": "Intel", "sector": "Entertainment/Tech" }
      ]
    },
    {
      "name": "outer",
      "order": 3,
      "color": "teal",
      "description": "Broad consumer life sectors",
      "sectors": [
        "Living",
        "Mobility",
        "Health / Recreat.",
        "Work",
        "Consumption",
        "Education",
        "Socialize",
        "Entertainment"
      ]
    }
  ],
  "annotations": {
    "arrow": {
      "present": true,
      "direction": "points inward",
      "points_to": "inner ring (near udemy/amazon)"
    }
  },
  "visual_attributes": {
    "concentric_rings": true,
    "palette": ["teal", "yellow", "white", "gray"],
    "labels_visible": true,
    "logos_present": true
  }
}
